summary: The concept of "online hate speech," categorized under "rights and freedoms," pertains to expressions that incite violence or hatred against individuals or groups based on attributes such as race, religion, or sexual orientation. In EU legal and regulatory frameworks, this term redirects to the preferred term "hate speech," which encompasses various forms of discriminatory discourse. The EU has established directives and regulations aimed at combating hate speech, particularly in digital environments, to uphold fundamental rights while ensuring freedom of expression. Effective measures include monitoring online platforms and enforcing compliance with anti-discrimination laws to protect vulnerable communities from harm.
